Package java_gui

Class ActionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java_gui.ActionHandler
  • public class ActionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    The ActionHandler class manages the user interactions, order processing, and scene transitions within the application. It connects to the database, handles authentication, updates the order display, and manages buttons for adding items, changing scenes, and completing orders. Additionally, it tracks daily sales and provides functionality to reconnect to the database in case of a failure.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionHandler

        public ActionHandler()
        Constructs an ActionHandler object and establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database. Displays an error dialog if the connection fails.

    • Method Detail

      • reconnectToDb

        public void reconnectToDb()
        Re-establishes the connection to the database if it has been lost or interrupted.

      • authenticateUser

        public void authenticateUser​(java.lang.String ID)
        Authenticates the user by querying the database with the provided user ID. If the user is found, updates the sign-in status and manager role.
        Parameters:
        ID - the user ID to authenticate

      • newItemButton

        public javax.swing.JButton newItemButton​(java.lang.String label,
                                         int productID,
                                         int... bounds)
        Creates a new JButton for adding an item to the order with specified bounds. The button updates the order and the subtotal/total displayed in the UI.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        productID - the ID of the product associated with the button
        bounds - the bounds for setting the button's position and size
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • newSceneButton

        public javax.swing.JButton newSceneButton​(java.lang.String label,
                                          javax.swing.JPanel currentScene,
                                          javax.swing.JPanel newScene,
                                          int... bounds)
        Creates a new JButton for changing scenes with specified bounds. The button hides the current scene and shows the new scene, updating the order display.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        currentScene - the current scene (JPanel) to hide
        newScene - the new scene (JPanel) to display
        bounds - the bounds for setting the button's position and size
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

        currentScene - the current scene (JPanel) to hide
        newScene - the new scene (JPanel) to display
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • newEntryButton

        public javax.swing.JButton newEntryButton​(int number,
                                          javax.swing.JTextArea inputArea)
        Creates a new JButton for entering numbers into a JTextArea. The button appends the number (or a decimal point) to the input area.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to display on the button (-1 for a decimal point)
        inputArea - the JTextArea to append the number to
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • authButton

        public javax.swing.JButton authButton​(java.lang.String label,
                                      javax.swing.JTextArea inpArea,
                                      javax.swing.JPanel currentScene,
                                      javax.swing.JPanel newScene)
        Creates a new JButton for authenticating the user and changing scenes if sign-in is successful.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        inpArea - the JTextArea for user input (e.g., user ID)
        currentScene - the current scene (JPanel) to hide
        newScene - the new scene (JPanel) to display if the user is authenticated
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • landingScreenButton

        public javax.swing.JButton landingScreenButton​(java.lang.String label,
                                               javax.swing.JPanel currentScene,
                                               javax.swing.JPanel newScene,
                                               javax.swing.JPanel signInScreen)
        Creates a new JButton for navigating from the landing screen to another scene. If the user is signed in, switches to the new scene; otherwise, directs to the sign-in screen.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        currentScene - the current scene (JPanel) to hide
        newScene - the new scene (JPanel) to display if the user is signed in
        signInScreen - the sign-in screen (JPanel) to display if the user is not signed in
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • managerScreenButton

        public javax.swing.JButton managerScreenButton​(java.lang.String label,
                                               javax.swing.JPanel currentScene,
                                               javax.swing.JPanel newScene,
                                               javax.swing.JPanel signInScreen)
        Creates a new JButton for navigating to the manager screen. If the user is a signed-in manager, switches to the manager screen; otherwise, directs to the sign-in screen.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        currentScene - the current scene (JPanel) to hide
        newScene - the new scene (JPanel) to display if the user is a manager
        signInScreen - the sign-in screen (JPanel) to display if the user is not a manager
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • newCashOuButton

        public javax.swing.JButton newCashOuButton​(java.lang.String label,
                                           javax.swing.JPanel newScene)
        Creates a new JButton for finalizing a cash-out and updating daily sales. The button clears the order, resets the subtotal/total, and updates the total daily sales.
        Parameters:
        label - the label for the button
        newScene - the scene (JPanel) to display after the cash-out is completed
        Returns:
        the newly created JButton

      • updateDailySalesJLabel

        public void updateDailySalesJLabel()
        Resets the daily sales total and updates the JLabel displaying the total sales for the day.
